str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Strengthened for a primary edo; used only in certain tenses, the rest being supplied by phago; to eat.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To drink, imbibe. A prolonged form of pio, which poo occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses; to imbibe.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
A glutton. From phago; a glutton.
An excessive wine-drinker. From oinos and a derivative of the alternate of pino; a tippler.
Friendly; subst: a friend, an associate. Properly, dear, i.e. A friend; actively, fond, i.e. Friendly.
A publican, collector of taxes. From telos and oneomai; a tax-farmer, i.e. Collector of public revenue.
Sinning, sinful, depraved, detestable. From hamartano; sinful, i.e. A sinner.
